title: Mike Deveney
text:
Michael Deveney (born 14 December 1965) is a Scottish former <a href="Boxing">boxer</a>, who represented the UK at the <a href="1988%20Summer%20Olympics">1988 Summer Olympics</a> before a professional career that included winning the British <a href="featherweight">featherweight</a> title in 1995.
Career.
Born in Elderslie, Deveney first made his mark as an amateur, representing the UK at the 1998 Olympics in <a href="Seoul">Seoul</a> at <a href="bantamweight">bantamweight</a>.
He made his professional debut in February 1991 with a points win over the unbeaten John George. A mixed record in his first four years as a professional included defeats at the hands of <a href="Barry%20Jones%20%28boxer%29">Barry Jones</a> and <a href="Elvis%20Parsley">Elvis Parsley</a>, but in January 1995 he got a shot at the vacant British featherweight title against <a href="Wilson%20Docherty">Wilson Docherty</a>; Deveney won narrowly on points to become British champion. Deveney lost the title in his first defence eight months later, when he was outpointed by <a href="Jon%20Jo%20Irwin">Jon Jo Irwin</a>. Previous to that title defence, he lost an 8 round non-title fight against Dean Phillips, who floored him twice en route to losing 5 of the 8 rounds to the Welshman.
Deveney twice made unsuccessful challenges for the <a href="BBBofC">BBBofC</a> Scottish Area title in 1996, both against <a href="Brian%20Carr">Brian Carr</a>.
He continued boxing until 1998, finishing with a record of 22 wins, 19 losses, and 1 draw.
